intro: Bupleurum petraeum f. incurvum, commonly known as the rock angelica, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often umbellate inflorescences. The plant is distinguished by its compact growth habit and distinctive, reflexed leaflets. It thrives in rocky and calcareous soils, typically in high-altitude environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
